questions.question: Which of the following principles is not considered to be an environmental worldview?
Evaluating the importance of a species based solely on its usefulness to humans considers its ________ value.
Human-centered worldviews tend to focus on
All of the following precepts describe the deep ecology worldview except
choices: nonhuman forms of life have value regardless of their use to us.
the relationship between humans and the environment is improving.
a decrease in the human population is necessary.
humans are damaging the natural environment with their excessive interference.

questions.question: Which of the following ideas does not fall under environmental literacy?
choices: The earth cannot permanently support our current lifestyle.
Environmental tipping points can be reversed.
Human impacts on natural capital are growing.

questions.question: In most developed nations, nature is appreciated for its ________ value.
Living more sustainably focuses solely on nature.
Living sustainably involves
choices: ignoring the value of other species.
collecting natural capital before it is depleted.

questions.question: People who have decided to reduce their incomes and alter their lifestyles to foster relationships and community or personal interests are known as
In affluent societies, people tend to
choices: consider the social and environmental implications of any purchases.
